content: Where are the permissions to merge to repositories defined? I realised just now that I haven't an ability to merge to our llvm fork, which I think I probably should.
Does anybody know anything about this?
i think that's just manually done? the teams repo magically makes github teams, but i don't think anything automatically assigns permissions to those teams.
That's correct, I hadn't seen that before
Er, this thread that is
Let me take a look
looks like wg-llvm did not have access to the llvm fork
I've adjusted permissions to be wg-llvm only, at maintain, for now
that means @cuviper you lost "admin" permissions; if those actually are necessary we can likely regrant but I hope/think they shouldn't be, not sure though
(feel free to ping me if something stops working)
@nagisa ^ - you should have access to merge now
I can, thanks!
I have occasionally used admin perms to bypass branch protection when we're preparing a new branch
(I don't mess with a branch after it's used by rust though)

cuviper said:

I have occasionally used admin perms to bypass branch protection when we're preparing a new branch

maybe that's a sign branch protection should be turned off? or made more reliable?
ah, interesting. I'm not sure if maintainer is enough for that - is there a chance you could check?
I don't have access to those settings right now
but that's ok
we can wait until I run into that situation again
hm, alright. it shouldn't be a problem to grant the group admin in theory, just annoying to couple it to that.. (it also e.g. lets you add other collaborators)
let's wait and see when it comes up
